verbose_text: Magnetic resonance (MR) diffusion weighted imaging (DwI) is a technique for obtaining good image contrast by exploiting the properties of water molecule " diffusion " within tissue; the apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC, expressed in mm 2 / s), is a quantitative parameter calculated by DwI, which combines the effects of capillary perfusion and mobility of water molecules, thus reflecting the cellularity of tissues and integrity of cell membranes.
